column5: hey everyone, Just want to point out first of all, I'm not looking for anyone's honey holes or GPS coords, I have my own little piece of heaven that I pull em out of on the lake, or at least used to for the first 20 years of my life, But having said that, I was wondering if the action is hot ? what sizes people have been pullin out and maybe the ideal times of day ? Like i said earlier, I used to fish the lake all season long as a young fry and it seemed heavily fished even then.. so curious what the fishery is like now.. but then again, any other info would not be turned down either
wow, 72 views and not anyone willing to help me out... thanks  glad i signed up
Ever think maybe no one has fished there lately???This is the most helpful Fishing related community on the net.You just have to be patient and ask the right questions man.
Seriously just give it a bump, stay positive and post pics of fish, if anyone has any info they may pipe in. I have never fished the lake and don't target walleye often so I am no help to you.

I haven't been there yet this year but in years past I did ok over by Halimar resort's dock(s).  In that bay and in the channel towards the other BIG resort close to them, I just forget the name of the other resort.  All were caught on grub's with a jig.

Haven't fished it for a couple of years. We managed a few and found that a jig and minnow worked better then the plastics. Nothing big but a nice average size. This would be about 3 or 4 years ago now when I was there last. Good luck and looking forward to your report.

ya I took that into account and it was quickly bumped down under other more recent posts too, so figured it might have gotten missed, as for posting pix ? well hard to post when i haven't been yet lol. I can post lots of other bass pix tho from various places if that will get you talking lol
ok, well gotta get ready for work, but will glady post some braggin rights bass pix asap. (just one thing, it keeps saying "file to big for upload" how do i shrink it ?)
well was able to figure out how to shrink a couple, but had errors with a bunch of others, will have to add more later... enjoy
couple more, and as said b4 gotta head to work, now.. I promise more once we hall in the 'eyes over labor day
Open an account wih Photobucket. Then you dont have to worry about shrinkage anymore

If it's anything like any of the other Haliburton Lakes, the best time to target them is at dusk along any weeds edges you can find. The north end of the lake is best from what I hear. I would definitely start with a twister and then tip it with a minnow if there is no luck. Crankbaits are also worth a try.
i've found a good old fashioned lucky strike and "cheater" trailer hook tipped with a gulp alive leech to work wonders too... any thoughts ?
